notesStmt.note: Slight worming at ends. Usage stains.

Yohanan Treves: inscribed, folio 126v.Folio 126v: 'Io Pelegrino Treves [...] Magio 1562'. Hippolite of Ferrara, Franciscan censor (active 1590-1609, Cremona?): inscribed with his name, 1601 (folio 126v), see 18-19, 93.
Giovanni Domenico Vistorini: inscribed 'Gio. Dom. Vistorini 1609' (olio 125v), see 85-87. Jacobus Geraldini: inscribed with his name, "1555. die 16 dec[em]bris revidus p[er] d Jac[obu]m Geraldini", notarized by "Caesar Belliossus curiae ep[iscopa]lis Bon[oniensis]": folio 125v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Quires of 10 leaves each, marked at the end by repeated words from the following folio.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive and Ashkenazi semi-cursive scripts of the 15th century, occasionally punctuated. Elḥanan ben Yo᾿av Eliyah of Ḳorio: inscribed, folio 125v.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Choboth Hal-Lebaboth. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Additional 26,952.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi(b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 62: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum: inscribed, folio [128v] (fse002v).
